Name: Seating Arrangement / Puzzles
Key Points / Tips: Complex puzzle describing people sitting in order (line or circle) or with attributes. **Tip**: Draw a diagram (circle or line), use placeholders. Use elimination tables for attributes. Tackle definite statements first ("A sits immediate left of B"), then use clues to narrow possibilities. Keep track of all constraints; it's often a matter of fitting pieces satisfying all clues.

Name: Series (Number/Alphabet series)
Key Points / Tips: Identify pattern in sequence of numbers or letters. Could be arithmetic (±,×) or alternating patterns. **Tip**: Write differences or ratios for number series. For letters, map to positions (A=1 etc.) to see jumps. Common ones: squares, primes, Fibonacci, or alternating addition/subtraction. Practice common sequences.

Name: Data Interpretation (Charts/Tables)
Key Points / Tips: Graphs or tables and questions. **Tip**: Scan the chart to understand variables. Do quick calculations for percentages or ratio if asked. Careful with units. Sometimes approximate if options are far apart. Manage time: don't get bogged down in heavy calculation – often a logical estimation works.

Name: Synonyms & Antonyms (Vocabulary)
Key Points / Tips: Test of word meanings. **Tips**: Improve vocabulary – know common difficult words seen in exams. **Trick**: If unsure, eliminate obviously wrong choices (e.g. a synonym likely same part of speech). Recognize prefixes/suffixes: e.g. "inevitable" – synonyms: unavoidable

Name: Sentence Arrangement (Para Jumbles)
Key Points / Tips: Given shuffled sentences forming a paragraph. **Tip**: Find the logical order: usually start with an introductory sentence (often the one defining a topic, lacking pronouns that refer back). Look for connecting clues: pronouns ("this", "he") refer to something mentioned earlier; chronological or logical sequence words ("However", "Finally") indicate position. Trial and error pair sentences and form the best flow of ideas.

Name: Numbers (Number system basics)
Key Points / Tips: Types (natural, integers, primes), LCM/HCF, divisibility. Patterns: remainders, last digit, cyclicity, unit digit, digit-sum, base conversion. Trick: use modular arithmetic for remainder patterns.

Name: LCM & HCF (advanced applications)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: smallest number divisible by..., largest number dividing..., HCF via Euclid, LCM-HCF relation, co-primes. Trick: prime factorization for fast multi-number LCM/HCF.

Name: Simplification & Approximation
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: BODMAS, fraction simplification, decimals, surds approximations, option-elimination by range. Trick: round smartly, keep 2 significant steps, use ratio scaling.

Name: Percentages
Key Points / Tips: Percent = part/whole*100. Patterns: successive % change, population change, markup-discount chain, comparison. Trick: fraction equivalents (50%=1/2, 25%=1/4), successive change = a+b+ab/100.

Name: Profit and Loss
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: profit-loss%, discount, markup, MP-SP-CP relations, dishonest weights. Trick: assume CP=100 for % questions; successive discounts multiply.

Name: Discounts (standalone)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: single discount, successive discounts, equivalent discount, discount with GST, marked price changes. Trick: equivalent discount = a+b-(ab/100).

Name: Average
Key Points / Tips: Avg = sum/n. Patterns: missing term, weighted average, combined average, average speed special cases. Trick: deviation method: sum deviations = 0.

Name: Ratio and Proportion
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: division in ratio, inverse ratio, continued proportion, partnership linkage. Trick: convert to fractions, use componendo-dividendo where useful.

Name: Partnership
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: profit sharing by capital*time, different investment times, salary/commission partner. Trick: compute 'money-months' then ratio.

Name: Mixture and Alligation
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: mixing % solutions, price mixtures, replacement, repeated dilution. Trick: alligation X-rule gives quantity ratio quickly.

Name: Simple Interest (SI)
Key Points / Tips: SI = (P*R*T)/100. Patterns: rate changes, time comparisons, installment-based SI. Trick: treat rate-time as linear multipliers.

Name: Compound Interest (CI)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: annual/half-yearly compounding, CI-SI difference, growth/decay. Trick: use (1+r/100)^n, for small r use approximation when options are far.

Name: Time and Work
Key Points / Tips: Work-rate model. Patterns: efficiency ratios, wages, alternate days, groups joining-leaving. Trick: take LCM work units; combined time formula for two workers.

Name: Work and Wages
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: wage proportional to work done, efficiency to wage mapping, partial work payments. Trick: convert to 'work units' then split proportionally.

Name: Pipes and Cisterns
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: fill-drain together, leaks, intermittent pipes. Trick: rates add, draining is negative; use LCM tank units.

Name: Time, Speed and Distance
Key Points / Tips: D=S*T. Patterns: relative speed, average speed, circular tracks, races. Trick: m/s to km/h = *3.6; same direction subtract speeds.

Name: Trains (crossing, platforms)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: train crossing pole/platform/another train, time to pass. Trick: distance = sum of lengths for crossing two trains.

Name: Boats and Streams
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: upstream/downstream, still water speed, meeting point. Trick: downstream=u+v, upstream=u-v.

Name: Algebra (Equations)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: linear equations, quadratic roots, simultaneous equations, word-to-equation. Trick: plug options if numeric choices are present.

Name: Surds and Indices
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: simplify radicals, rationalize denominators, exponent laws, comparing surds. Trick: convert to common base where possible.

Name: Logarithms (basics)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: change of base, log identities, solving simple log equations. Trick: log_a(xy)=log_a x + log_a y.

Name: Inequalities (basic)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: range finding, inequality chains, modulus inequalities. Trick: test boundary values and sign changes.

Name: Sequences and Series (AP/GP)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: nth term, sum, mixed sequences, missing term. Trick: use common difference/ratio; for AP sum use n/2(2a+(n-1)d).

Name: Statistics (Mean, Median, Mode)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: median in sorted data, grouped data basics, mode identification, outlier effects. Trick: median position=(n+1)/2.

Name: Mensuration 2D
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: areas, perimeters, shaded regions. Trick: compare by ratio scaling; know circle-sector formulas.

Name: Mensuration 3D
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: volume-surface area of cube, cuboid, cylinder, cone, sphere; frustum basics. Trick: memorize core formulas; ratio scaling for similar solids.

Name: Geometry (2D shapes)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: triangles, circles, polygons, similarity, chord-tangent. Trick: angle chasing + similarity ratios; common Pythagorean triples.

Name: Coordinate Geometry (basics)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: distance, midpoint, section formula, slope, line equations. Trick: use slope comparisons for parallel/perpendicular.

Name: Trigonometry & Heights-Distances
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: angles of elevation/depression, multi-step triangles. Trick: memorize sin/cos/tan at 0,30,45,60,90; draw diagram first.

Name: Probability
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: coins/dice/cards, conditional probability, at least one, expected value basics. Trick: use complement for 'at least one'.

Name: Permutation & Combination
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: arrangements with repeats, circular permutations, selections with constraints. Trick: translate keywords order matters vs not.

Name: Age Problems
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: ratio ages, present-past-future equations, average age. Trick: keep timeline clear and write equations before computing.

Name: Clocks (time-angle)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: angle between hands, mirror time, gain-loss clock. Trick: minute hand 6 deg/min, hour hand 0.5 deg/min.

Name: Calendars (day-date)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: odd days, leap year rules, day-of-week. Trick: anchor to known reference and count mod 7.

Name: Blood Relations
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: direct relations, coded relations, family tree constraints. Tip: draw tree, mark gender and generation level.

Name: Direction Sense
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: multi-turn navigation, shortest distance, final direction. Tip: use compass axes, track coordinates, apply Pythagoras.

Name: Coding-Decoding
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: letter shifts, reverse alphabet, alphanumeric mapping, substitution cipher, matrix coding. Tip: map A=1..Z=26; check alternating patterns.

Name: Series (Number/Letter/Alphanumeric)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: difference, ratio, squares/cubes, primes, Fibonacci, alternating, mixed letter-number. Tip: compute first and second differences; for letters use positions.

Name: Seating Arrangement (Line/Circle)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: circular with facing-in/out, double rows, conditional attributes. Tip: fix one person to break rotation; use constraints table.

Name: Ranking and Order
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: positions from left/right, rank swaps, relative ordering. Tip: convert to positions on a number line and solve systematically.

Name: Analogy (verbal reasoning)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: word relationships, number analogies, figure analogies. Tip: identify relation type: part-whole, cause-effect, function, degree.

Name: Classification (odd one out)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: choose item not fitting rule (semantic, numeric, shape). Tip: test 2-3 plausible rules quickly, eliminate.

Name: Venn Diagrams (set logic)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: overlap counts, union-intersection, syllogism-like set inference. Tip: draw clean sets and track totals, avoid double counting.

Name: Syllogisms (Logical Deduction)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: All/Some/No, possibility cases. Tip: use Venn diagrams, remember converse errors.

Name: Statement and Assumption
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: implicit assumptions, necessary vs sufficient, hidden premises. Tip: check if assumption must be true for statement to hold.

Name: Statement and Conclusion (inference)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: must-be-true conclusions, logical inference, syllogistic inference. Tip: reject conclusions introducing new info.

Name: Statement and Argument
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: strong vs weak arguments, relevance, scope. Tip: strong arguments are practical and directly address the statement.

Name: Cause and Effect
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: identify cause, effect, or both; reverse causality traps. Tip: prefer direct causation and avoid speculative links.

Name: Course of Action / Decision Making
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: best action among options given scenario constraints. Tip: choose feasible, ethical, and directly corrective actions.

Name: Logical Games (rule-based)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: constraints, moves, win/lose, scheduling, allocation. Tip: formalize rules, test edge cases, use elimination.

Name: Data Sufficiency
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: determine if statement(s) uniquely answer question. Tip: test A alone, B alone, then combine; avoid full calculation when possible.

Name: Critical Reasoning (strengthen/weaken)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: assumption questions, inference, strengthen, weaken, resolve paradox. Tip: find conclusion, evidence, gap.

Name: Vocabulary: Synonyms
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: direct synonym, contextual synonym, closest meaning. Tip: eliminate wrong parts of speech; learn roots/prefixes.

Name: Vocabulary: Antonyms
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: direct antonym, degree-based opposites, contextual antonym. Tip: watch for 'not' traps and near-opposites.

Name: One Word Substitution
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: replace phrase with single word, common exam vocab. Tip: build themed lists: people, places, actions, groups.

Name: Idioms and Phrases
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: meaning, fill idiom in sentence, error in idiom usage. Tip: learn most frequent idioms and typical contexts.

Name: Sentence Correction (Grammar)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: subject-verb, tense, modifiers, parallelism, articles, prepositions. Tip: scan for 1-2 core errors, avoid over-editing.

Name: Spotting Errors (grammar)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: identify erroneous segment, or no error. Tip: check agreement, pronoun reference, misplaced modifiers first.

Name: Cloze Test
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: passage with blanks testing vocab + grammar. Tip: read full passage theme, fill easy grammar blanks first, then meaning-based.

Name: Fill in the Blanks
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: single blank, double blank, connector-based. Tip: use grammar structure, then meaning; eliminate mismatched tone.

Name: Sentence Completion
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: complete sentence logically and grammatically. Tip: predict word before seeing options to avoid bait choices.

Name: Selecting Words (context)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: choose correct word for context, collocations. Tip: focus on tone, tense, and common word pairs.

Name: Para Jumbles (Sentence Arrangement)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: 4-6 sentence reorder, odd sentence out, paragraph formation. Tip: find opening sentence, track pronouns and connectors.

Name: Reading Comprehension
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: main idea, inference, tone, vocabulary-in-context, author intent. Tip: map paragraph purpose; avoid extreme options.

Name: Verbal Analogies
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: word-pair relation, category, function, degree. Tip: name the relation explicitly before choosing.

Name: Data Interpretation (overview)
Key Points / Tips: Core graph reading + arithmetic. Patterns: totals, averages, % change, ratio comparison, max-min, rank. Tip: build quick mental math for % and fractions.

Name: DI: Table Charts
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: row-column operations, multi-year comparison, missing entries. Tip: mark units, compute row totals first.

Name: DI: Bar Graph
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: single bar, multi-bar, stacked bar. Tip: convert to differences quickly and use estimation if options are spaced.

Name: DI: Line Graph
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: trends, slope change, point comparisons, growth rates. Tip: focus on deltas between points and time intervals.

Name: DI: Pie Chart
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: sector to value, multiple pie comparisons. Tip: memorize common angles: 10%=36°, 25%=90°, 50%=180°.

Name: DI: Caselet (text-based)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: paragraph data, missing graph, derived values, constraints. Tip: create a mini-table before calculating.

Name: DI: Mixed Graphs
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: combine bar+line or table+pie; cross-source inference. Tip: solve one variable at a time, avoid mixing units.

Name: Non-Verbal: Mirror Images
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: left-right inversion, clock-face, letters and shapes. Tip: apply lateral inversion, check distinctive corners.

Name: Non-Verbal: Water Images
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: top-bottom inversion like reflection in water. Tip: flip vertically, keep left-right same.

Name: Non-Verbal: Paper Folding
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: fold sequence then punch/cut, predict unfolded. Tip: track symmetry lines, mirror the cut across folds.

Name: Non-Verbal: Paper Cutting
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: folded paper cut shapes, choose correct unfolded. Tip: reflect cuts across each fold layer carefully.

Name: Non-Verbal: Embedded Figures
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: find hidden figure in complex image. Tip: scan edges and distinctive angles first.

Name: Non-Verbal: Figure Matrix
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: 2x2 or 3x3 matrix with transformations. Tip: identify operations per row and per column: rotate, add, subtract, overlay.

Name: Non-Verbal: Pattern Completion
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: complete missing figure, sequence of transformations. Tip: focus on one attribute at a time (count, orientation, shading).

Name: Non-Verbal: Cubes and Dice
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: net folding, opposite faces, dice rotations. Tip: build opposite-face pairs; use 3-face corner rule.

Name: Non-Verbal: Rule Detection
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: identify governing rule for figure group. Tip: test invariants like number of sides, intersection count, shading parity.

Name: Non-Verbal: Dot Situation
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: paper folds with dots and symmetry mapping. Tip: treat each fold as reflection of dot positions.

Name: Psychometric: Situational Judgement Test (SJT)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: best-most/least effective, rank actions, choose response. Tip: prioritize ethics, clarity, ownership, and collaboration; avoid extreme or evasive responses.

Name: Psychometric: Personality (Big Five)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: Likert statements, consistency checks, social desirability traps. Tip: be consistent and realistic; do not over-optimize answers.

Name: Psychometric: Forced-choice / Ipsative
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: choose between equally desirable statements, ranking items. Tip: decide which behavior is most like you in work context; consistency matters.

Name: Game-Based Aptitude: Pymetrics-style games
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: attention, memory, risk, decision, learning games. Tip: stay calm, optimize for consistent behavior; accuracy before speed unless clearly rewarded.

Name: Game-Based Aptitude: Grid/Motion/Switch/Digit challenges
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: multitasking, path planning, fast rule switching, digit recall. Tip: develop a stable strategy quickly and avoid strategy thrashing mid-game.

Name: Game-Based Aptitude: Company-specific game rounds
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: mini-games set, random selection, time-boxed tasks. Tip: practice generic skills: scanning, working memory, decision under time.

Name: Cryptarithmetic (Alphametics)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: addition/subtraction alphametics, carry constraints, unique digits, leading letter not zero. Tip: solve column-wise from right to left; use constraints to prune early.

Name: Cryptarithms (general practice)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: verbal arithmetic, sometimes with multiple solutions. Tip: list constraints, track used digits, prioritize most constrained letters.

Name: Essay Writing (WAT/Placement)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: opinion, pros-cons, problem-solution, abstract topics. Structure: intro with thesis, 2-3 body points with examples, conclusion summarizing. Tip: outline in 3-5 minutes then write.

Name: Essay Writing: Argumentative essay
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: take a stance, defend with reasons and evidence, counterargument. Tip: keep thesis debatable and consistent; use transitions.

Name: Essay Writing: Common prompt-types (IELTS-style)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: opinion, discussion, advantage-disadvantage, problem-solution, direct questions. Tip: identify prompt type first, then use correct paragraph plan.

Name: Logical Puzzles (interview-style)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: weighing puzzles, river crossing, truth-liar, constraints puzzles. Tip: define state representation, test minimal cases.

Name: Matchstick Puzzles (spatial + arithmetic)
Key Points / Tips: Patterns: move/add/remove sticks to fix equation or form shapes. Tip: search invariants: match count, shape edges, digit segments.
